ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The people of Nuh denied the Messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The people of Noah accused the apostles of lies.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The people of Noah gave the lie to the Messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people of Noah rejected the Messengerss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The people of Nooh denied the Noble Messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The people of Nuh denied the Messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The people of Nuh rejected the apostles.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: The people of Noah cried lies to the Envoys
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The people of Noah also rejected the messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And Nuh's people belied the sent ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The people of Noah impugned the apostles
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The people of Noah rejected the messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The people of Nuh (Noah) belied the Messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The nation of Noah, belied their Messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The people of Noah disbelieved the messengers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The people of Noah denied the messengers
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:105] The people of Noah denied the messengers, by denying him, for they all brought the same message affirming God’s Oneness; or [it is] because he stayed among them for so long that it was as though he was many messengers (the feminine [person of the verb kadhdhabat, ‘denied’, governed by] qawm, ‘the people’, is on account of the import, but it is masculine on account of its [morphological] form);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 414 (Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah)) i.e. they denied Noah and all the other messengers who were mentioned by Noah,
